SET.summary: Set the value for the given key, with an optional TTL.
example: SET 0 foo bar // This will create a 'foo' item with the 'bar' content and no TTL.
SET 0 foo newvalue // Overwrite the old value of 'foo'.
SET 10 hello world // Create a 'hello' item that is going to expire in 10 seconds
notes: This operator will fail for LOCKed items.
On success the new set value will be returned, otherwise an error.

MSET.summary: Set the value for keys verifying the given prefix.

args.name: key
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

example: SET 0 app:news:item:hits 10 // This will create a 'app:news:item:hits' item with the '10' content and no TTL.
notes: This operator will fail for LOCKed items.
Return the number of modified items, otherwise an error.

TTL.summary: Set the TTL of a key.
example: TTL foo 10 // Now 'foo' has a 10 seconds ttl
notes: This operator will fail for LOCKed items.

MTTL.summary: Set the TTL for keys verifying the given prefix.

args.name: key
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

example: MTTL f 10 // Now both foo and fuu have a 10 seconds ttl
notes: This operator will fail for LOCKed items.

MUNLOCK.summary: Remove the lock on keys verifying the given prefix.

args.name: key
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

UNLOCK.summary: Remove the lock from the given key.

LOCK.summary: Prevent the given key from being modified for a given amount of seconds.

args.name: time
args.desc: The time in seconds to lock the item.

example: DEL foo // this will fail since foo is now locked

MLOCK.summary: Prevent keys verifying the given prefix from being modified for a given amount of seconds.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

example: DEL foo // this will fail since both foo and fuu are now locked

PING.summary: Ping the server instance to refresh client last seen timestamp.
notes: This is useful to keep alive the connection with the server.

META.summary: Obtain a specific information about a given item.

args.name: key
args.desc: The key of the value to search.

args.name: field
args.desc: The information name to retrieve, allowed values follow.

enum.size: The size in bytes of the item value.
enum.access: Timestamp of the last time the item was accessed.
enum.ttl: Item specified time to live, -1 for infinite TTL.
enum.left: Number of seconds left for the item to live if a ttl was specified, otherwise -1.
enum.lock: Number of seconds the item is locked, -1 if there's no lock.

example: META foo encoding // will print 'foo' encoding
META foo access // last access time

INC.summary: Increment by one the given key.
example: SET 0 foo 10 // foo encoding is GB_ENC_PLAIN now
INC foo // Now foo is 11 encoded as GB_ENC_NUMBER
notes: INC will change internal value encoding from GB_ENC_PLAIN to GB_ENC_NUMBER
Return the new incremented value in case of success, otherwise an error.
If the value is not a parsable number, REPL_ERR_NAN will be returned.

MINC.summary: Increment by one keys verifying the given prefix.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

example: MINC f // Now foo is 11 and fuu is 2
notes: MINC will change internal value encoding from GB_ENC_PLAIN to GB_ENC_NUMBER
Return the number of succesfully incremented values in case of success, otherwise an error.

GET.summary: Get the value for a given key.
notes: Return the item value in case of success, otherwise an error.

MGET.summary: Get the value for a given prefix.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

notes: Return a REPL_KVAL with keys and values verifying the given expression in case of success, otherwise an error.

STATS.summary: Get system stats about the Gibson instance.

The following values will be returned:.server_build_datetime: Date and time the server was built.
The following values will be returned:.server_allocator: Memory allocator used by the server.
The following values will be returned:.server_started: Unix timestamp the server was started.
The following values will be returned:.server_time: Internal unix timestamp of the server.
The following values will be returned:.first_item_seen: Unix timestamp of the first created item.
The following values will be returned:.last_item_seen: Unix timestamp of the last created item.
The following values will be returned:.total_items: Number of total items stored by this server-
The following values will be returned:.total_compressed_items: Number of LZF compressed items stored by this server.
The following values will be returned:.total_cron_done: Number of cron loops the server has performed since it was started.
The following values will be returned:.total_connections: Number of connections the server received.
The following values will be returned:.total_requests: Number of valid requests the server executed.
The following values will be returned:.memory_peak: Max used memory since the server was started.
The following values will be returned:.reqs_per_client_avg: Average number of requests per client.

notes: This operator will fail for LOCKed items.

MDEL.summary: Delete keys verifying the given prefix.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

notes: This operator will fail for LOCKed items.
Return the number of deleted items in case of success, otherwise an error.

DEC.summary: Decrement by one the given key.
example: SET 0 foo 10 // foo encoding is GB_ENC_PLAIN now
DEC foo // Now foo is 9 encoded as GB_ENC_NUMBER
notes: DEC will change internal value encoding from GB_ENC_PLAIN to GB_ENC_NUMBER
Return the new decremented value in case of success, otherwise an error.
If the value is not a parsable number, REPL_ERR_NAN will be returned.

MDEC.summary: Decrement by one keys verifying the given prefix.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

example: MDEC f // Now foo is 9 and fuu is 0
notes: MDEC will change internal value encoding from GB_ENC_PLAIN to GB_ENC_NUMBER
Return the number of succesfully decremented values in case of success, otherwise an error.

COUNT.summary: Count items for a given prefix.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.

KEYS.summary: Return a list of keys matching the given prefix.

args.name: prefix
args.desc: The key prefix to use as expression.
